info.description: This is the API for the Compliance Framework Configuration Service.
info.title: Compliance Framework Configuration Service API

post.description: Create a catalog with the given title

get.description: Get a specific catalog by its ID

delete.description: Delete a specific catalog by its ID

patch.description: Update a specific catalog by its ID

post.description: Create a control with the given title

get.description: Get a specific control by its ID

put.description: Update a specific control by its ID

post.description: This method attaches metadata to a specific revision.
post.summary: Attaches metadata to a specific revision

400.description: Bad Request: Error binding the request

post.description: Creates a new plan in the system

get.description: Fetches a plan in the system

put.description: Activate a plan by its ID. If the plan is already active, no action will be taken.

500.description: Internal server error. The plan could not be activated.

get.description: Return the risks of the result with the given ID.

post.description: This method creates a new task and adds it to a specific plan.
post.summary: Creates a new task for a specific plan

200.description: Successfully added the task to the plan

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: Error binding the request

post.description: This function is used to create an activity for a given task.

get.description: Returns id and title of all the plans in the system
Returns data of all the latest results for a plan

post.description: Returns the compliance over time records for a particular streamId
post.summary: Get Compliance Over Time for stream

get.description: Returns a list of all the results for a strea,data of all the latest results for a plan

post.description: Create an SSP with the given title

get.description: Get an SSP by its ID

put.description: Update an SSP with the given ID

delete.description: Delete an SSP with the given ID

diagrams.description: Diagrams is an optional collection of visual representations of the boundary.

filename.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64.

media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource.

controlUuids.description: Reference to controls. Controls is an array of objects in the database

title.description: Doesn't exist in OSCAL for some reason ü§∑üèª

originActors.description: Actors / Tasks Identify the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity

diagrams.description: Description is a summary of the system's data flow.

caption.description: Caption provides a brief annotation for the diagram.

uuid.description: Uuid is a machine-oriented, globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this diagram elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances.

scheme.description: Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI.

system.description: One of: http://fedramp.gov, http://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal, http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal, http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal/unknown, http://cve.mitre.org, http://www.first.org/cvss/v2.0, http://www.first.org/cvss/v3.0, http://www.first.org/cvss/v3.1

implementationStatementId.description: ImplementationStatementId Reference to the implementation statement in the SSP to which this finding is related.

originActors.description:
Actors identify the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity
Maps to the OSCAL "origins" property

ids.description: NOTE: This part is a bit blurred

system.description: This is an enum but right now it has only one value: http://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-60v2r1

end.description: Identifies the end date and time of an event. If the event is a point in time, the start and end will be the same date and time.

start.description: Identifies the start date and time of an event.

originActors.description: Actors / Tasks Identify the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity

class.description: An optional textual providing a sub-type or characterization of the part's name, or a category to which the part belongs.

id.description: A unique identifier for the part.

name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type, which exists in a value space qualified by the ns.

ns.description: An optional namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

title.description: An optional name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.
Title A name given to the assessment plan. OSCAL doesn't have this, but we need it for our use case.

base64.description: A resource encoded using the Base64 alphabet.

citation.description: An optional citation associated with the resource.

description.description: An optional short summary of the resource.

document-ids.description: Document identifiers associated with the resource.

title.description: An optional name given to the resource.

uuid.description: A unique identifier for a resource.

lifecycle.description:
Identifies whether this is a recommendation, such as from an assessor or tool, or an actual plan accepted by the system owner.
One of: recommendation, planned, completed

originActors.description: Actors / Tasks Identify the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity

description.description: A human-readable summary of the identified risk, to include a statement of how the risk impacts the system.

originActors.description: Actors / Tasks Identify the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity

statement.description: A summary of impact for how the risk affects the system.

status.description: Describes the status of the risk.

security_sensitivity_level.description: The overall information system sensitivity categorization, such as defined by FIPS-199.

system_ids.description: One of http://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal, https://fedramp.gov", http://ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122", https://ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122

system_name.description: The full name of the system.

system_name_short.description: A short name for the system, such as an acronym, that is suitable for display in a data table or summary list.

information_types.description: Contains details about one information type that is stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

subjects.description:
Subjects hold all the subjects that the activities act upon.
TODO: Should this be []Subject?

id.description:
The unique identifier of the catalog.
Required: true
Example: "123abc"

title.description: TODO: We are keeping it minimal for now for the demo

id.description:
The unique identifier of the plan.
Required: true
Example: "456def"

scopes.description: Scopes can be either `Condition` or nested `Query`.
